pullRequest.body:
This adds a new file `RingTheory.RootsOfUnity.AlgebraicallyClosed` that contains an instance showing that algebraically closed fields have enough `n`th roots of unity when `n` is not divisible by the characteristic.

We add a new file because of the additional imports required in addition to `RingTheory.RootsOfUnity.EnoughRootsOfUnity`.

---

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

@YaelDillies Your "maintainer delegate" didn't seem to have an effect.

Whoops, then

maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.

Thanks!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11742598442/job/32713642131)

maintainer delegate

apart from that. Thanks!
This filename is a bit of a mouthful. What about `RingTheory.RootsOfUnity.AlgebraicallyClosedField` or `RingTheory.RootsOfUnity.AlgebraicallyClosed`?
Sounds good.

```suggestion
    have : NeZero n := .of_neZero_natCast F
```
same below
OK; done.

```suggestion
# Algebraically closed fields have enough roots of unity
```
I'd rather leave the title in view of eventually adding an instance for `Circle` as well.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory/RootsOfUnity/AlgebraicallyClosed): new file
